works fine after I fix the base library. Seems it's caused by a bad library.

Please following the following guidelines when doing import:

For importing with CM enabled, including importing xml, configuration, and plugins, please following the following steps:

1. first of all, make sure the base library is valid, i.e, when you open the library, you should not see error dialog showing any unloaded resources
2. make sure you checked in all your changes before importing
3. when import prompt for check out files, always check out
4. You should not see the add new files dialog any more during importing, but just in case it still appear,  always say no and report the scenario to the DEV team
4. aftter importing, 
        if the import failed, or you want to discard the imported content, then do the following:
 	a. switch to resource perspective
     	b.  find all checked out files, and un-do check out, or if you are using CVS, do an update and override the local files, 
	c. find all the private files and delete them
	d. re-open the library
       if the import is successful and you want to keep the change, then do the following:
	a.  switch to resource perspective
	b. find all private files and add into CM system, don't add the "logs" folder
	c. find all checked-out files and check them  in
	d. re-open the library
